title: Integrative Health
author: The Children's Hospital
description: Integrative healthcare enhances traditional medicine with complementary therapies to address the whole person. Families interested in this holistic approach to health and wellness may benefit from CHOP's Integrative Health Program.
cleaned_text: enhances traditional medicine with complementary therapies — such as acupuncture, yoga, aromatherapy, massage and mindfulness — to address the whole person. Families interested in this holistic approach to health and wellness may benefit from CHOP's Integrative Health Program. Our team of specially trained providers offers children evidence-based integrative therapies that are safe, effective and can help improve your whole family's quality of life. The Integrative Health Program at CHOP The Integrative Health Program at CHOP is a program that aims to integrate conventional medicine with complementary therapies in order to provide comprehensive care to pediatric patients. [View more](/pages/integrative-health-program-chop) Massage Therapy & Acupuncture Clinics Massage Therapists: - Jennifer Evans, LMT - Tiffany Silliman Cohen, LMT Massage Therapy Clinic Hours: - Wednesday, 11:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. - Last Thursday of the month, 10 a.m. - 2 p.m. Physician Acupuncturist: - Winona Chua, MD Acupuncture Clinic Hours: - Tuesdays, 1 - 5 p.m. Our clinics are located on Philadelphia Campus in the Buerger Center for Advanced Pediatric Care. After you get your badge at the first floor Welcome Desk, go to the 12th floor to check in. Patients are advised to park in the Buerger Center underground parking garage at 3500 Civic Center Blvd. Our providers have years of experience working with children in medical settings. Please talk to your doctor about whether massage therapy or acupuncture will benefit your child. Providers or caregivers can direct questions to [integrativehealth@chop.edu.](https://stage-chop.pantheonsite.io/intregrativehealth%40chop.edu.) Our Programs and Services Our Team At CHOP, the Integrative Health Program is focused on offering integrative therapies that are evidence-based, from providers who are trained in caring for pediatric patients.
